intro: Dugandiodendron yarumalense, commonly known as the Yarumal tree, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and large, palmate leaves. The plant produces showy, clustered flowers that are typically pink or red in color, attracting various pollinators. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its unique botanical features, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
